Diana espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente de esta manera, y así podrá ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y unas mayores oportunidades de acceder a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who has gone through many struggles in her life, yet through great effort and working every day she has been able to get ahead. At 34 years of age, she is a single parent and head of a household of 2 children,14 and 6 years old, who were left by their father a long time ago. Diana works at a restaurant in her area, which allows her to generate income, but not enough to sustain the cost of her home and provide a good quality of life for her children.

That's why Diana decided to start a business of selling goods. Her sister has contacts that can provide the goods at affordable prices, and thus she'll have a higher profit margin.

Diana hopes to start selling clothing such as shirts, pants, and women's blouses, so that she can generate extra income for her home. Because Diana does not have enough capital to acquire the inventory of merchandise to sell to her customers, she hopes that a loan will give her the ability to purchase clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses among others, and thus be able to offer her customers a good deal of merchandise.

Diana expects revenues to increase significantly in this way, so she can offer her children a better life and greater opportunities to access high quality education.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses and more

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story:  

I am a second year student at Strathmore University taking a Bachelor's degree in Commerce. I come from a family of five. I have two sisters: the eldest is doing an engineering degree while the other is in primary school. 
My parents are self-employed. It is a real struggle for them to raise money for school fees for my siblings and me. I have had a great passion for joining a university ever since I started schooling. I have a great interest in doing Business and, after a lot of research, I settled on Strathmore University because it has a good reputation and it offers quality education. It is the best business school and I wanted to go to the best.
As I move higher in my studies, a laptop has become an important asset. Currently my parents cannot afford to purchase one for me. A laptop will enhance my studies and make it easier to access notes and other important information both on campus and off campus. It will also make access to my blog easier, and I will be in a position to update it more often.
I would like to advance my studies with a Master's and would also like to start my own business.
My message to the world is to live one day at a time, enjoy life and be happy all the time. We should also grab opportunities as they come, so as not to lose out on something great.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will help her conduct research, access the University's e-learning site (e-library), upload assignments and update her blog.

loans.name: Lucely Janeth

texts.es:
Lucelly se ha convertido en una persona que da lo mejor de si en su trabajo con el ánimo de poder sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.
Lucelly se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 4, 4 y 8 años de edad, los cuales manifiesta son su principal impulso para hacer las cosas con más dedicación cada día.
Lucelly tiene un taller de confección, donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y se especializa en confeccionar acolchados. Gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y permitirles tener una mejor calidad de vida, pues con los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanza para cubrir las necesidades básicas.
Lucelly tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, pues sus productos son muy reconocidos por ser de muy buena calidad y porque Lucelly siempre ofrece el mejor servicio y el mejor trato con sus clientes. Debido a esto, Lucelly requiere comprar insumos para elaborar los acolchados para hacer entrega del pedido a sus clientes, pero Lucelly no cuenta actualmente con el dinero suficiente para poder hacer compra de estos insumos. Es por esto que Lucelly espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la confección de sus acolchados como son telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros, y poder así cumplir con sus pedidos sin afectar sus ingresos mensuales.
Lucelly tiene un gran sueño y es el de poder tener un taller bien grande donde pueda generar empleo y en el cual pueda hacer realidad su sueño de que sus 3 hijos tengan una estabilidad económica que en un futuro les permita acceder a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucelly has become a person who gives her all to her work in hopes of moving her business and her family forward.  Lucelly is married and the mother of three children who are 4, 4 and 8 years old who she says are her main impulse to do things with more dedication every day.

Lucelly has a sewing workshop where she makes items for third persons; her specialty is quilts.  Thanks to this activity she’s able to generate the necessary income to help cover household expenses and to be able to have a better quality of life because her husband’s income isn’t enough to cover basic needs.

Lucelly has large pending customer orders because her products are very well known because they are of very good quality and because Lucelly always provides the best service and best treatment to her customers.  Because of this, Lucelly needs to buy raw materials to make the quilts in order to fill customer orders but Lucelly does not currently have enough money to purchase said materials so is hoping for a loan that will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to make the quilts such as fabric, thread and needles, among others, to be able to fill her orders without affecting her monthly income.

Lucelly’s great dream is to be able to have a large workshop where she can generate employment and make her dream come true of providing economic stability for her three children so that in future they can have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luz Fatima

texts.es:
Luz Fatima se ha caracterizado por ser una persona que siempre ha buscado una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Luz Fatima vive con su esposo desde hace aproximadamente 13 años, y con el inicio el negocio de una tienda donde vende productos de confitería y cervezas. 
Luz Fatima tuvo que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, lo cual ha hecho que quiera que su familia no tenga que pasar por las mismas.

El negocio que tiene ha tenido muy buenas ventas, por lo que Luz Fatima ha podido colaborar a su esposo en las obligaciones del hogar. 
Debido a que no tiene mucho capital, su negocio no tiene mucho surtido, y sus clientes le han pedido productos que ella no tiene en su tienda, es por esto que ha visto como pierde clientes poco a poco. Con el ánimo de cambiar esta situación Luz Fatima quiere surtir su negocio, para lo que requiere comprar mercancía, sin embargo, no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar estas compras por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de confitería y cervezas para surtir su tienda general, y de esta manera poder atender todas las necesidades de sus clientes.

Luz Fatima espera que con la compra de estos productos, sus clientes aumenten considerablemente, debido a que ya encontrarán más productos con los cuales satisfacer sus necesidades. Luz Fatima sueña con que ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz Fatima has been characterized as a person who has always sought a better life for her family. Luz lives with her husband of about 13 years, and started her business in a shop selling confectionery goods and beer.

Luz Fatima went through many hardships in her life, and she doesn't want her family to have go through the same hardships.

The business has had very good sales, so Luz Fatima has been able to share the household duties with her husband.

Because she does not have much capital, her business does not have much variety. Her customers have asked for products that she does not have in her store, which is why losing customers little by little. In an effort to change this Luz Fatima wants to buy more varied goods for her business, which requires the purchase of merchandise. However, she does not have enough money to make these purchases so she hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to access the purchase of confectionery goods and beer to fill her general store, and thus be able to meet all the needs of her customers.

Luz Fatima hopes that with the purchase of these products, her customers will increase considerably, because they will find more products which meet their needs. Luz Fatima dreams that she and her husband can have a better quality of life and economic stability.

loans.use: buy confectionery goods and beer to fill her general store

loans.name: Mche

texts.en:
Mche is 57 years old. She is a widow with six children aged between 10 and 20 years. She describes herself as a resilient woman. Previously, she was involved in a greengrocer business, and for the past 20 years she has been running a restaurant in addition to the greengrocer. She sells tea, food, snacks, etc. 

She describes her place of operation as viable and busy. Her primary customers are repeat and walk-ins. Currently, she has three employees. She describes her business challenge to be the high prices of ingredients used in preparing food and tea. She will be using the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more vegetables and fruits for her grocery store. 

In the next five years, Mche's hope and dream is to run a big hotel in her nearby town. She plans to use the profits and proceeds from the business to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Ofelia

texts.es:
Luz Ofelia se ha caracterizado por ser una emprendedora de toda la vida que siempre tiene ideas innovadoras para crear. Casada y madre de 2 hijos, Luz Ofelia se dedica a la actividad de la confección de productos para mascotas, como son collares, casas, vestidos, entre otros, y gracias a esto ayuda a generar junto con su esposo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Luz Ofelia ha visto como sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente, pues desde que abrió su negocio, sus productos han sido reconocidos por la buena calidad de los mismos. 

Luz Ofelia actualmente tiene un buen nivel de ventas y quiere seguirlo aumentando. Es por esto que ahora está sacando un nuevo producto que es una mochila en donde transportar a las mascotas en caso de salir de la casa, y este producto ya tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Como Luz Ofelia no cuenta con un capital suficiente para comprar la materia prima que necesita para la fabricación de estos productos, tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como telas, hilos, cremalleras, entre otros, y poder fabricar el producto y entregar los pedidos a sus clientes.

Luz Ofelia sueña con que su negocio crezca y cada vez sea más reconocido, además, de poder abrir un punto de venta al público. Luz Ofelia sueña con que sus hijos y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, y en un futuro, quiere poderles brindar a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Luz Ofelia has been an entrepreneur all of her life.  She always has innovative ideas to actualize.  She is married and has two children.  Luz Ofelia makes pet products like collars, houses, clothes, and others.  Thanks to this she helps generate, along with her husband, the income needed to support the household expenses.

Luz Ofelia has seen how her sales have increased considerably since she opened her business.  Her products have been recognized for their good quality.  Luz Ofelia currently has a good level of sales, and she wants it to continue increasing.  That is why she is now bringing out a new product, a backpack for transporting pets when leaving home.  There are already large customer orders for this product.

Luz Ofelia does not have enough capital to buy the raw material she needs to make these products.  She hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, zippers, and others.  Then she will be able to make the product and deliver the orders to her customers.

Luz Ofelia dreams of her business growing and becoming more well-known.  She also dreams of being able to open a spot to sell to the public.  Luz Ofelia dreams that her children and her husband will be able to have a better quality of life.  In the future she wants to be able to give her children the opportunity of a university education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, zippers, and others.

loans.name: Hector Fernando

texts.es:
Héctor es una persona reconocida en su región por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada a su esposa. 
Héctor, con 28 años de edad, ha dedicado toda su vida al trabajo en el campo, donde ha aprendido entre otras labores la de la crianza de vacas lecheras.
Es en esta actividad que Héctor se encuentra desempeñando actualmente, y gracias a la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Héctor tiene vacas lecheras en un terreno arrendado, y la leche que producen las vacas se la vende al dueño del terreno que se lo arrienda, pues Héctor no tiene un tanque o recipiente donde pueda verter la leche. 
Actualmente, a Héctor le están ofreciendo una ternera a muy bajo precio, por lo que no quiere desaprovechar la oportunidad y comprarla, pues esta le aumentaría su capacidad de producción, y así obtendría más ingresos, sin embargo, Héctor no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprarla, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de la ternera y poder así aumentar su producción, y aumentar sus ingresos en cuanto venda la leche.
Héctor tiene un gran sueño y es el de poder tener su propio terreno, en el que pueda tener su casa propia, y en el que pueda tener sus vacas.
Héctor quiere que su esposa pueda tener unas mejores condiciones de vida a las actuales, y es por esto que siempre trabaja fuertemente para poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder así ofrecerle un mejor bienestar en su vida.
texts.en:
Héctor is well known in his region for being hardworking and dedicated to his wife.  At 28 years old, Héctor has spent his entire life working in the fields, where he’s raised dairy cows, as well as doing other things.  This is what he does now and it generates the income he needs to support his household.

He has dairy cows on the rented lands.  He doesn’t have a storage tank to keep the milk, so he sells it to the land owner.  

Héctor has been offered the opportunity to buy a calf at a very low price and he wants to buy it and not miss out on this chance.  This will allow him to increase his production and his income; however he doesn’t have the necessary capital.  He hopes that a loan will allow him to buy the calf and increase his production and income when he sells the milk.

He has a great dream of owning his own land where he can have a home and his cows.

He wants his wife to have a quality of life better than the one she has now, so he always works hard to increase his income and be able to provide for her well-being.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Yeisy Andrea

texts.es:
Yeisy es una persona que se esfuerza todos los días con el ánimo de salir adelante. Proviene de una familia que no le pudo brindar una gran estabilidad económica, por lo que ella quiere lograr brindársela a sus padres y tener igualmente una estabilidad con su esposo. Yeisy se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 2 años a la actividad de la confección, la cual aprendió gracias a trascendencia familiar, y desde entonces genera los ingresos trabajando en esta actividad. Tiene un contacto con una empresa de prendas de vestir, por lo que Yeisy les ofrece el servicio de confección.

Yeisy ha tenido muy buenos contratos con esta empresa, y ha hecho que su taller salga adelante, sin embargo, Yeisy quiere sacar su propia línea de ropa, para poder tener dos fuentes de ingresos. Es por esto que va a comprar telas e hilos para la confección de su ropa; sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de telas e hilos para la producción de prendas de vestir. 

Yeisy sueña con sacar su línea propia y que esta sea reconocida en diferentes regiones. Además, sueña con que ella y su esposo puedan tener una buena estabilidad económica y no tengan que sufrir tantas adversidades en su vida como le ha tocado a Yeisy.
texts.en:
Yeisy is a person who struggles every day with the intention to succeed. She comes from a family that could not provide economic stability, so she wants to achieve this and offer stability to her parents as well as her husband. Yeisy been working for about 2 years in making apparel, which she learned through family, and has since generated income by working in this activity. She has a contact with a clothing company, so Yeisy gives them her clothes-making services.

Yeisy has had very good contracts with this company, and it has allowed her work to progress, however, Yeisy wants to sell her own line of clothing in order to have two incomes. This is why she is buying fabric and thread for making clothes. But she does not have enough capital to make these purchases, so she hopes that a loan will give her the ability to purchase fabric and yarn for the production of clothing.

Yeisy dreams of having her own line of clothing and that it would be sold in different regions. In addition, she dreams that she and her husband can have good economic stability and they will not have to suffer many adversities in their lives, as Yeisy has.

loans.use: buy fabrics and yarns for clothing production.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story: 

I am 21 years old and currently studying at Strathmore University where I am taking a Bachelor of Commerce degree and a professional course in accountancy. I am the first born in a family of six. All my siblings are at college, high school and primary school. My parents are teachers by profession.

My biggest challenge is school fees. I chose to pursue university education because of who I want to be in the future, and I chose Strathmore University because of the good quality education and the high level of discipline it upholds. This loan will help me purchase a laptop that I will use in my studies. Most of my course work is on the e-learning site and it is difficult to access if you don't have a laptop. My area of interest is accounting and to become perfect in it I have to do a lot of reading and practice. 

My desire is to have a country where all people are treated equally and also to see Kenya becoming a better place for all.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will help her access course work from the e-learning site, upload assignments and conduct research.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:  

I am the first born in a family of five girls and two boys. Two of my sisters are pursuing college education.

My biggest challenge has been inadequacy of finances for my education. I had a hard time financing my high school education and I had to secure a scholarship to afford university education. 

I decided to pursue university education so that I can gain the necessary skills and knowledge required to compete in the job market. This will help me achieve my long-term dream of making the world a better place. I chose Strathmore University because of the quality of education offered and the opportunities that one is exposed to while here. The fact that the university does not discriminate in terms of race, finances, religion or ethnic background is also a reason that made me choose Strathmore.

The laptop will help me finish my final year project on time, since I can access my coursework off-campus. It will also help me to develop IT skills by widening my knowledge in the field of software development, as I will have more time to develop systems. It will also help me complete assignments on time.

I would like to be employed for a few years after university and, thereafter, start an IT firm dealing with application service provision. I believe that it is our responsibility to leave the world a better place than we found it for the sake of the future generations.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him access university coursework off-campus, finish assignments on time and develop his IT skills.

loans.name: Neville

texts.en:
Neville is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

I live in a family of six siblings. I am in year one of my Bachelor of Commerce degree. I have a strong passion for IT and programming, which I am studying on my own.

Strathmore University undoubtedly offers the best quality in Kenya's higher education. That is why it is my university of choice. In many ways, this laptop loan will aid in the realization of my dream to become an established programmer and IT guru. Furthermore, it will see me through to contribute to the advancement of education in IT and probably create jobs for the many jobless Kenyans.

I am self-driven and highly motivated with big dreams and great passion for learning and creating new things. I also love charity work and – God willing, if my dreams come true – I would like to be a major contributor to Kiva loans to extend the help offered to the needy and less fortunate around the world. Owning a laptop will be a milestone towards achieving this dream.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will assist in his Information Technology studies so he can realize his dream of becoming a programming guru and entrepreneur.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story: 

My family consists of five people. I am the first born; I have one sister, one brother and both parents. I decided to purse university education so that I could gain the necessary skills and knowledge required to compete at the higher levels of the job market. This is so I can achieve my long-term dream of being the best that I can be.

I chose Strathmore University because of the quality of education offered and the opportunities that one is exposed to at the university. The main reason I need this loan to purchase a laptop is so I can finish my final year project on time. The laptop will give me flexibility in working on the project. I will also hand in my assignments on time, since I will be able to access coursework off-campus. Finally, it will help me to perfect my IT skills in readiness for the job market and entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop so as to finish her final year project on time and later enhance her IT skills in preparation for the job market.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:

My family consists of four members: two sisters, my father and me. My mother passed on in 1996. My biggest challenge has been educating myself since my father is poor and; hence, raising school fees all the way through has not been easy. Thank God I have always gotten well-wishers on my way! I have always had a goal to reach the peak of education and getting a degree doesn't mean that I will have done all I want to do.

I chose Strathmore University since it is one of the best universities in the world and top in Africa, and it produces the best students in finance and accounting fields. I am applying for this loan to enable me to purchase a laptop which will help me with my assignments, studying and doing research. In fact, it will be a long-term asset in my accounting career. I want to advance my career in accounting and finance and be one of the best.

I believe that life is always hard work and for someone to succeed, he should be patient, trust God and be persistent.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will help him finish assignments on time, study and do more research in accounting.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

My name is Charles. I am the first born of a family of three siblings; that is me and my two sisters. Both sisters are starting high school this year. My mother is a housewife and my dad passed on last year. I have succeeded in my studies despite the challenges I have had with limited resources. My big challenge is finances because so far I have been relying on limited donations from relatives, well-wishers and bursaries. Due to the high cost of university education, they are unable to support me. It’s the need to quench my thirst for skills, knowledge and exposure that has made me decide to pursue university education. 

Strathmore is the best place for me because they offer high quality education and have mentorship and formation programs that will help me in my future endeavors. I am applying for this loan to enable me to purchase a laptop which will facilitate my learning by helping me do the assignments and do research for more exposure and understanding. Most of my coursework is best accessed through e-learning and, therefore, a laptop will be essential.

I am pursuing accounting and finance in order to get great business ideas and experiences that will enable me to raise the living standards of Kenyans and Africans as a whole. We need the means to eradicate poverty among the many slums in Africa, improve food security and improve the management of funds allocated to education so as to ensure all students benefit fairly. I intend to venture into entrepreneurship activities so that I can give back to society. It is by empowering people intellectually that most of the problems faced by developing countries can be eradicated.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will help him finish his assignments on time, access the University's e-learning site and carry out research.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos ha sido una persona que ha trabajado durante gran parte de su vida. Anteriormente montó un negocio de carnicería, pero no le fue como esperaba, por lo que cerró y decidió dedicarse a la actividad de la agricultura. Durante mucho tiempo se dedicó a cultivar legumbres y frutas, y posteriormente montó su propia legumbrería.
Hace 10 años que Luis Carlos tiene su legumbrería, la cual le da los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos del hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo, y la legumbrería tiene muy buenos clientes gracias los buenos productos que vende Luis Carlos.
Gracias a que tiene muy buenas ventas, Luis Carlos debe surtir su legumbrería con productos como frutas y verduras, sin embargo, Luis Carlos no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder llevar estas compras a cabo. Es por esto que Luis Carlos aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra del surtido de frutas y verduras, con el cual pueda tener en su legumbrería una cantidad de productos consecuente con la cantidad que le compran sus clientes.
Luis Carlos espera que sus ventas sigan incrementándose y poder tener un negocio rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, el cual le pueda generar una estabilidad económica y un futuro estable para su familia y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos has been a person who has worked for most of his life.  He used to have a butcher shop but it didn’t work out like he expected so he closed it and decided to go into farming.  For a long time he farmed fruit and vegetables and later on opened his own vegetable shop.  He’s had it for about ten years now and it produces income needed to cover his household expenses.  He lives with his wife and son and the vegetable shop has very good customers thanks to the good products Luis Carlos sells.

Thanks to his sales being good, Luis Carlos must stock the vegetable shop with products like fruit and vegetables.  However, Luis Carlos does not have sufficient capital to make this purchase and this is why Luis Carlos is hoping for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables so that his vegetable shop will have a good amount of products that will be commensurate with his customers’ purchases.

Luis Carlos hopes that his sales will continue increasing and to have a profitable business that will last through time and generate economic stability and a stable future for his family and his children.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una persona que se ha visto enfrentada a muchas adversidades en su vida. Desde que su esposo la abandonó a ella y a sus hijos, Nancy se ha visto en la obligación de generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir, al menos, vagamente las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 
Nancy, con 37 años de edad, es una madre soltera cabeza de familia a cargo de 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años, a los cuales siempre les ha querido brindar el mejor bienestar posible.
Nancy anteriormente trabajaba en la calle haciendo el rebusque de los ingresos para sus hijos y ella, pero un día se dio la tarea de montar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, y desde entonces este ha sido su fuente de ingresos para poder sostener los gastos de sus 2 hijos y de ella.
Nancy ha visto como su clientela se ha incrementando debido a sus buenos productos y el buen servicio que ofrece. Debido al incremento en sus ventas, Nancy ha visto como su negocio poco a poco ha ido vendiendo toda la mercancía que tenía, es por esto que ahora requiere de la compra de más mercancía para poder tener su negocio bien surtido para la venta a sus clientes.
Sin embargo, Nancy no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar esta mercancía, gran parte debido a que inicia la temporada escolar y debe pagar las matrículas del estudio de sus hijos; es por esto que Nancy tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir como blusas, medias, sudaderas, entre otros para poder tener su negocio bien surtido, para poder afrontar las compras de sus clientes.
Nancy tiene el sueño de que su negocio crezca y se consolide en su sector, de modo que pueda tener diferentes puntos de venta y generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Nancy quiere que sus 2 hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad y en un futuro poder acceder a un empleo que sea bien remunerado y puedan también montar su propia empresa o continuar con el negocio de su madre.
texts.en:
Nancy is a person who has faced many adversities in her life.  Since her husband abandoned her and her children Nancy’s has needed to generate sufficient income to cover, at least, her basic household expenses.  Nancy is 37 years old and a single mother head of household in charge of two children who are 7 and 14 years old and who she’s always wanted to provide the best possible wellbeing for.

Nancy used to work in the streets collecting recyclables to earn income for herself and her children but one day she decided to open a business of her own selling clothes and since then it’s been her source of income to support her and her two children’s expenses.

Nancy has noted how her clientele has been increasing due to the good products and service she offers.  Due to her increased sales, Nancy has seen how the business has gradually sold out all the merchandise it had so she now needs to buy more merchandise to have a business that’s well-stocked for her customers.  However, Nancy does not have sufficient capital to buy this merchandise due in large part that the new school term has begun and she’s had to pay tuition for her children’s schooling so she’s hoping for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing like blouses, stockings and sweatshirts, among others, to have her business well-stocked to be able to respond to customers’ purchases.

Nancy’s dream is that the business grows and consolidates in the sector so that she can have various sales points and generate employment for needier people.  Nancy wants her two children to have access to a quality education and in future be able to attain well-paid jobs so that they can open their own businesses or continue with their mother’s.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Otto Elmer

texts.es:
Otto, de 32 años de edad, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de Joyas en la ciudad de Granada. El creció trabajando junto a su padre quien le enseño este oficio pero al morir su padre el se tuvo que hacer cargo del  trabajo que talvez no sean las maquinas mas modernas que tiene para hacer sus joyas pero si con las que el se ayuda a llevar el alimento diario a su familia. El elabora todo tipo de piezas de joyas en materiales de oro y plata, distribuye su producto en las ciudades de León y Managua aunque a el  le gustaría vender en otras ciudades pero la falta de materia prima es una de las limitantes ya que son muy caras. 
Es por ello que realizo el crédito para  compra de plata y piedras artificiales para hacer anillos, cadenas, dijes, pulseras.  Ya que necesita materia prima para trabajar y vender para mejorar sus ingresos. En lo futuro le gustaría irse a  Costa Rica  vender parte de las piezas que realiza y tener maquinas mas modernas que le ayuden a mejorar la calidad de sus joyas.
texts.en:
Otto, 32, makes and sells jewelry in the city of Granada.  He grew up alongside his father who taught him that occupation but when his father died he had to take over the work.  He may not have the most modern machines to make his jewelry but they do help him provide daily bread for his family.  He makes all types of gold and silver jewelry which he sells in the cities of León and Managua although he would like to sell in other cities too but the lack of raw materials which are very expensive limits him.

Because of this he took out a loan to buy silver and artificial gem stones to make rings, chains, charms and bracelets because he needs raw materials to work and sell to improve his income.  In future, he’d like to go to Costa Rica to sell part of the pieces he makes and to have modern machines that will help him improve the quality of his jewelry.

loans.use: to buy silver and artificial gem stones.

loans.name: Nazareth

texts.es:
Nazareth ha sido reconocida en su sector por ser muy trabajadora y siempre sacar a su familia adelante. Con 51 años de edad es una madre de 4 hijos, a los cuales es la encargada de generarles los ingresos para el hogar y poder brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Nazareth anteriormente tenía muchas dificultades para acceder a un empleo, pero gracias a que al lado de su casa queda una empresa, le propusieron que vendiera los desayunos y los almuerzos al personal de la empresa. Nazareth aceptó esto e inició con la venta de las comidas para ver si así podía generar ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente Nazareth tiene muy buenas ventas, el personal cada vez ha crecido más, y esto ha hecho que Nazareth no los pueda atender a todos.

Nazareth quiere poder atender a todo el personal de la empresa, y para esto tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de vajillas y alimentos que le permitan preparar las comidas y poder atender a todo el personal de la empresa. Nazareth espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente pues el personal por atender es muy grande y sus comidas han sido caracterizadas por la buena calidad.

Nazareth sueña con tener un gran restaurante y poder generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además, sueña con brindarles a sus 4 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una prosperidad económica.
texts.en:
Nazareth is known in her neighborhood for being very hard working and always getting her family by. At 51 years of age, she’s the mother of 4 children who are in her care, and she’s responsible for generating the household income and for providing a good quality of life. Previously Nazareth had a lot of trouble getting a job, but thankfully the company next to her house asked her to sell breakfasts and lunches to the company’s employees. Nazareth accepted this and began to sell meals to generate a household income. Now Nazareth has good sales. The number of employees has grown, and this has made Nazareth unable to serve them all. 

Nazareth wants to be able to serve all the company’s employees. In order to do this she has the hope that a loan will enable her to get dishes and ingredients to prepare meals and be able to serve all of the company’s employees. Nazareth hopes that in this way her income will grow considerably since the number of employees to serve is very big, and her meals are known for being of good quality.

Nazareth dreams of having a big restaurant and to be able to generate lots of jobs for people in need. Also, she dreams of giving her 4 children a better quality of life and financial prosperity.

loans.use: to buy dishes and ingredients which will allow her to prepare means and be able to serve all of the company's employees.

loans.name: Rosa Adriana

texts.es:
Rosa de oficio comerciante, de 33 años de edad, originaria de Granada, es dueña de una pulpería. El primer apoyo que recibió para poner su pulpería fue de su madre quien es dueña de un tramo en el mercado loca de Granada ya que le sugirió ganarse sus propios ingresos y no depender de nadie y así mismo mantener a su hijo de 6 años de edad. Desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en la pulpería que no solo le permite tener ingresos propios sino que también puede cuidar de su hijo más de cerca. 
Solicita el préstamo para compra de granos básicos, aceites, frijoles, leche, pan , huevo, detergentes jabones, avenas, papel de baño. Pues tiene como meta convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de productos comestibles en general.
texts.en:
Rosa, 33, is a merchant.  She’s from Granada and owns a grocery store.  The first support she got to set up her grocery store was from her mother who owns a space in Granada’s local market and she suggested that she should earn her own income and not depend on anyone and thus support her six-year-old son.  Since then, she’s worked in the grocery store which not only allows her to earn her own income but also to be able to have her son nearby to take care of him. 

She’s asking for the loan to buy basic grains, oil, beans, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, oatmeal and toilet paper because her goal is to turn her grocery store into a general foodstuffs distributing center.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yorleni De La Cruz

texts.es:
Yorleni, vive en la ciudad de Granada, ella vende leña y pan , es casado y tiene una niña de 8 años de edad que esta estudiando la primaria. Su esposo y su suegra tienen 15 años de dedicarse  a la venta de pan y leña pero su suegra le cedió la administración del negocio. Hoy en dia ella y su esposo se dividen las tareas del hogar y el negocio para poder generar ingresos para los gastos de su hogar. Ella vende pan y leña al por menor en toda granada ofrecen de casa en casa y a las pulperías.
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de leña y pan para vender al detalle. Con el crédito podrá comprar más cantidad de estos productos los cuales necesita vender y mantener abastecido a sus clientes. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y acondicionar mejor el lugar donde almacena la leña.
texts.en:
Yorleni lives in the city of Granada; she sells bread and firewood.  She’s married and has an 8-year-old little girl who attends elementary school.  Her husband and mother-in-law have been selling bread and firewood for 15 years but her mother-in-law passed the administration of the business to her.  Today, she and her husband share household tasks and the business in order to generate income to cover household expenses.  She sells bread and firewood at retail throughout Granada door to door and to grocery stores.

She took out the loan in order to buy firewood and bread to resell at retail.  With the loan she will be able to buy larger amounts of these products that she needs to sell and continue supplying her customers.  One of her dreams is to improve the infrastructure of her dwelling and to better furnish the place where she stores the firewood.

loans.use: to buy bread and firewood to sell at retail.

loans.name: Yohana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Yohana, de 36 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante, vende refrescos y hielo, habitante de la ciudad de Granada. Ella empezó con este negocio a los 25 años de edad, ella trabajo atendiendo una pulpería en casa de una tía pero al casarse tuvo que cambiarse de casa, estando ahí empezó a vender su refrescos naturales y hielo de esta manera aporta para pagas los gastos de su hogar y su esposo la ayuda con el salario que el gana como guardia de seguridad. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar pollo y queso para vender ya que esta agregando mas producto para vender y diversificar su negocio generar ingresos. Ella quiere ir ahorrando para hacer local junto a su casa para vender sus productos y hacer mas sostenible su negocio.
texts.en:
Yohana, 36, is the mother of three children.  She’s a merchant by profession selling beverages and ice; she resides in the city of Granada.  She started this business at the age of 25.  She worked tending to a grocery store in an aunt’s house but when she got married she had to move out and once in her new place started to sell natural beverages and ice to contribute to household expenses; her husband helps her with the salary he earns as a security guard.

She took out the loan to buy chicken and cheese to sell since she’s adding more products to sell and diversify her business to generate income.  She wants to save up to build a locale next to her house to sell more products and make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy chicken and cheese.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz Mary es una persona totalmente dedicada a su familia, y trabaja fuertemente todos los días con el ánimo de sacarla adelante. Esta madre soltera cabeza de familia de 4 hijos, siempre les ha querido brindar todo lo mejor posible, desde una educación de calidad, hasta una prosperidad económica en sus vidas, sin embargo, se ha visto golpeada por muchas adversidades en su vida. Luz Mary cuando se vio en la obligación de generar los ingresos para su hogar, decidió montar una pequeña tienda en un espacio que acondicionó en su hogar y desde allí ha venido generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hijos.

Luz Mary actualmente presenta algunos inconvenientes en su negocio, debido a que su nevera (refrigerador) se encuentra averiado, por lo que no ha podido vender productos que requieran permanecer refrigerados, además por las bajas ventas no ha tenido capital con el cual surtir bien su negocio, y pronto se avecina una temporada de buenas ventas. Es por esto que Luz Mery acude a un préstamo con el ánimo de que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía para su hogar y también para reparar su nevera (refrigerador).

Luz Mery espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten, pues ya podrá vender más productos, entre ellos productos que requieran de permanecer refrigerados, y así le podrá ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a person who is totally dedicated to her family and works hard every day aiming to move them ahead.  She is single mother head of household with four children.  She’s always wanted to give them the best possible from a quality education to economic prosperity in their lives.  However, she’s been battered by many adversities in life.  When Luz Mary found herself with the obligation to generate household income, she decided to set up a small store in a space she set aside at home and from there she’s been generating the necessary income to support her children.

Luz Mery is currently facing some inconveniences in her store because her refrigerator is on the blink so she’s been unable to invest in products that need to be refrigerated and due to drops in sales she does not have capital with which to stock her store and the season of good sales is approaching.  Because of this, Luz Mery is calling on a loan hoping to be able to buy merchandise for her home and also to repair her refrigerator.  Luz Mery hopes that her income will increase this way because she’ll be able to sell more products among which those that require refrigeration and she will thus be able to provide her children with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to repair her refrigerator.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona que es reconocida entre sus familiares y vecinos por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer brindarles una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Oscar ha tenido grandes dificultades para poder acceder a un empleo, debido a que son muy pocas oportunidades las que se presentan. 
Oscar se dedica a la venta de ropa y sombreros en los municipios cercanos a su residencia, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Últimamente Oscar ha tenido muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, pero no cuenta con un inventario de mercancía que pueda responder a estos pedidos. Es por esto que Oscar espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de mercancía como sombreros y ropa que le permitan atender los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Oscar espera que sus ventas sigan incrementándose para poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Además, sueña con poder establecerse en un lugar fijo con su familia, donde no tenga que viajar tanto y pueda compartir más con ellos.
texts.en:
Oscar is known to his relatives and neighbors as a very hard worker and always wants to provide his wife and 2 children with a good quality life. Oscar has had much difficulty in finding a job, as there are very few opportunities that present themselves.

Oscar works in retail, selling clothing and hats in the municipalities close to his residence and thanks to this, he earns the income necessary to sustain his household.

Lately, Oscar has had many orders from his clients, but he doesn’t have the inventory to fill those orders. That’s why Oscar hopes a loan will permit his to buy merchandise, like clothing and hats, to attend to the demands of his clients.

Oscar hopes his sales continue growing so he can provide his wife and children with a better quality of life. Also, he dreams of being able to establish himself in a fixed place with his family, where he won’t have to travel so much and he can spend more time with his family.

loans.use: buy merchandise like clothing and hats, so he can fill his clients' orders.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio es una persona que ha sufrido diferentes adversidades en su vida, pero gracias a que es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora ha podido salir adelante. Desde hace un tiempo abandonó su ciudad natal y se desplazó en búsqueda de oportunidades de empleo, sin embargo, al no encontrar oportunidades de empleo, decidió montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de poder generar los ingresos para su hogar. Mauricio con 51 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de 1 hijo al cual le quiere brindar todo lo que necesita.

Mauricio ha venido trabajando en su negocio desde entonces, y ha podido crecerlo y posicionarlo en su sector. Gracias a esto tiene muy buena clientela y sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente. Ahora, Mauricio ha tenido que incurrir en diferentes gastos debido a que su hijo ingresa al estudio en estos meses, además ha sufrido algunos inconvenientes que le han hecho gastar mucho dinero. Con el ánimo de aprovechar el inicio de la temporada escolar, Mauricio quiere comprar artículos de papelería que le permitan tener un buen surtido para sus clientes, pero como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, Mauricio aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, cartulinas, entre otros, y poder así ofrecerles una buena variedad de mercancía a sus clientes.

Mauricio espera aprovechar esta temporada y lograr que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente. Además, poderles brindar a su hijo y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
Mauricio tiene el sueño de poderse comprar su casa propia, y tener su propio local donde montar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a person who has suffered various adversities in his life but thanks to his being a very hardworking and enterprising person he’s been able to overcome them.  Some time ago he left the city of his birth and moved in order to seek out employment opportunities.  However, not finding any employment opportunities he decided to open his own business hoping to generate income for his home.  Mauricio, 51, is married and the father of a son for whom he wants to provide everything he needs.

Mauricio has been working in his business ever since and has managed to make it grow and position it in its sector.  Thanks to this he has a good clientele and sales have increased considerably.  Now, Mauricio has had to take on various expenses because his son is starting school around now and he has also had some inconveniences that have cause him to spend much money. 

Hoping to take advantage of the start of the new school term, Mauricio is hoping for a loan that will allow him to purchase stationery supplies like notebooks, pencils, erasers and construction paper, among others to offer a good variety of merchandise to his customers.  Mauricio hopes to take advantage of this season and manage to increase income considerably as well as to be able to offer his wife and son a better quality of life.  Mauricio’s dream is to be able to buy a house of his own and to have his own locale in which to install his business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, construction paper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for repairing cars.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Yom is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lkhasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhasuren, 37, is a driver for a private company. He has been working as a driver for five years and he is a skillful driver, his co-workers say. 

Lkhasuren lives with his family in a "ger", a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Lately his "ger" cover is becoming old and is too thin in freezing cold winter weather. Therefore he needs to exchange it for new one. A "ger" cover is a core part of a Mongolian yurt and is made from sheep wool. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to covering the cost of new "ger" covering to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new "ger" covering.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old. She is a mother of one child. She sells men's suits to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's suits to sell.

loans.use: To buy men's suits to sell.

loans.name: Merlyna

texts.en:
Merlyna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Merlyna has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for  years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

Merlyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Merlyna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA.

loans.name: Dora Piedad

texts.es:
Dora es una persona que ha sufrido muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, la buena actitud que mantiene y las ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superar estas adversidades. Dora es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 3 hijos, puesto que el padre de sus hijos murió hace un tiempo. Desde entonces, Dora ha sido la persona encargada de generar los ingresos para su hogar, sin embargo, las pocas posibilidades de empleo han hecho que no sea nada fácil. Dora al ver que no pudo conseguir un empleo, decidió montar un negocio de comidas que hasta el momento le ha dado buenos resultados, pues a pesar de que la competencia es muy grande, la buena calidad de sus productos han hecho que los clientes la prefieran por encima de los otros negocios.

Dora vende su mercancía principalmente a vecinos del sector y familiares, por lo que quiere aumentar sus clientes para aumentar sus ingresos. Dora quiere montar un puesto de comidas en la calle para lo que necesita algunas mesas y sillas y poder adecuar un buen sitio para sus clientes, sin embargo, en la actualidad no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar estas compras por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de mesas y sillas para adecuar un puesto de comidas rápidas fuera de su casa.

Dora espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atraer más clientes a su negocio ya que estará visible para todos. 
Dora quiere que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, y tiene el gran sueño de poderse comprar algún día su casa propia, donde sus hijos puedan tener una estabilidad.
texts.en:
Dora is a person who has suffered many adversities in life.  However, her good attitude and the desire to get ahead have allowed her to overcome them.  Dora is a single mother head of household with three children because the father of her children died some time ago.  Since then, Dora has been the person in charge of generating income for her home.  However, the few employment opportunities have not made this very easy.  Seeing that finding employment was impossible, Dora decided to open a food business which to date has had good results because despite heavy competition the quality of her products have caused customers to prefer her over the other businesses.

Dora sells her merchandise primarily to neighbors in the sector and to family members but she wants to increase her clientele in order to increase her income.  Dora wants to set up a food stand in the street but needs some tables and chairs to furnish a good site for her customers.  However, she currently does not have enough money to make these purchases so is hoping for a loan that will allow her to buy tables and chairs to furnish a fast food stand outside her house.  Dora hopes that her income will increase considerably this way because she’ll be able to attract more customers to her business because it will be visible to everyone.

Dora wants her children to have a better quality of life and her great dream is to someday be able to buy a house of her own where her children can have stability.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Juliet has a beauty salon, or shop, that provides hair cutting, styling, and re-bonding. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor.

Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the beauty salon

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Tessie has a shop that sells fruits, vegetables, spices, and food seasonings. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe  is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Fe  has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Fe  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 41-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega, 56, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She also does farming, which leads to her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing products. She dreams of expanding her farming business.

With the KES 30,000, Ega wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 29 years old and married with one child aged four years. She runs a grocery store to earn a living, and she has been in the business for eight years. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans, maize and peas to sell.

loans.use: To buy  beans, maize and peas to sell.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 39-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Juditha has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Juditha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Marilou has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married.

Akil has been the owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and other dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to make an outdoor ceiling, a sliding door, and to add more foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an outdoor ceiling, a sliding door, and to add more foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 53 years old, is married and has a daughter and a son ages twenty and twenty-five years. She is an intelligent and patient woman. For the last three years, she has been selling charcoal to frequent customers. Her business is located at a busy and strategic place. 

Mariam describes her business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the charcoal retail store. She plans to use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more charcoal to boost her business. Mariam looks forward to diversifying her business in the future. Her hope and dream is to diversify her business by supplying charcoal regionally.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Letty has a shop where she makes & sells home-made sausage or "longganisa" & frozen foods like "tocino" & chicken. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making home-made sausage & frozen foods.

Letty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home-made sausage & frozen foods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Jessica has a shop that sells a variety of food, home, kitchen & beverage products. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy foods, house- & kitchenware & beverages.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foods, house- & kitchenware & beverages.

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es:
Alba ha sido una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy carismática y por ser muy trabajadora. Desde hace un tiempo viene desempeñando la actividad de la venta de mercancía, actividad que aprendió gracias a que una hermana suya también la desempeña. Alba, con el ánimo de poder ayudarle a su esposo en la generación de ingresos para su hogar, decidió iniciar esta actividad y actualmente tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, los cuales prefieren sus productos por la buena atención que ofrece. Alba también ha querido ayudar a la comunidad, por lo que actualmente esta realizando un curso de atención a la primera infancia. 

Alba, gracias a que sus ventas han ido aumentando, tiene grandes pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la mercancía a sus proveedores. Es por esto que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, shampoo, maquillaje, entre otros para atender los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Alba sueña con que su negocio le siga brindando ingresos para poder ayudarle a su esposo en la generación de ingresos para el hogar, y poder así mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus 4 hijos. Además, Alba sueña con tener un gran almacén donde pueda contratar a muchas personas que requieran de unos ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Alba is a person who characterizes herself as being very charismatic and a hard worker. For some time now, she has worked selling merchandise, something she learned from her sister who is also in this line of work. With the impetus of helping her husband with the household income, Alba, decided to start working and she actually has a good amount of customers who prefer her products because of the good customer attention she provides.  Alba also wants to help her community so she is taking a course on infant-toddler and pre-school care.

Thanks to her increasing sales, Alba has lots of orders from her customers. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to buy merchandise from her suppliers. This is why she has the hope that a loan will afford her the opportunity to buy personal care products like lotions, creams, shampoo and make-up, among other things, to fill her clients' orders.  

Alba dreams that her business will continue to provide income in order to help her husband with the household income, and that way, provide a better quality of life for her 4 children. Alba also dreams of having a big store where she could hire many people who are in need of household income.

loans.use: buy personal care products like lotions, creams, shampoo and make-up, among other things, to fill her clients' orders.

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
Jose es una persona que es caracterizada por sus ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante. Jose desde hace aproximadamente 10 años montó su cafetería donde atiende a sus clientes todos los días. Jose inició este negocio debido a que no encontraba oportunidades laborales y debió buscarse sus ingresos como independiente. Con el ánimo de incrementar sus ventas, Jose quiere comprar unas nuevas vitrinas, pues las que tiene ya se encuentran muy viejas, además de comprar surtido para su cafetería. Sin embargo, Jose no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía para su cafetería como es café, servilletas, entre otros, y la compra de una vitrina nueva donde exhibir sus productos.

Jose espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, además, espera que con unos mayores ingresos pueda brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is the type of person who is willing to work hard and wants to get ahead. Approximately ten months ago he opened a cafe where he serves customers every day of the week. He started the business as he couldn’t find any work so he had to earn a living through his own efforts. 

Because he wishes to increase his income, Jose wants to buy new display cabinets as the current ones are very old. As well he wishes to buy stock for his cafe. However, he cannot afford to make these purchases so he is hoping for a loan so he can buy coffee, serviettes, and a new cabinet so he can display his products.

Jose hopes that as a result his earnings will increase considerably and that with this additional money he will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy coffee, serviettes, and a new display cabinet

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es por esto que desde hace un tiempo decidió colaborarle a su esposo con la generación de ingresos para su hogar. Maria Margarita se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir a terceros, actividad que aprendió desde hace un tiempo gracias a un curso que tomó. Actualmente Maria Margarita tiene buenos pedidos de sus clientes, lo que hace que pueda colaborar en su hogar a que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Maria Margarita tiene un gran pedido de un cliente, por lo que requiere comprar insumos para la confección de este pedido. Es por esto que Maria Margarita acude a un préstamo con el ánimo de que le permita comprar insumos para la confección como es telas e hilos, además de poder realizarle el mantenimiento a su máquina de coser.

Maria Margarita espera que con esto sus ventas sigan aumentando, y de esta manera pueda brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Además, sueña con que en un futuro, sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is the type of person who is very hardworking and always wishing to provide her children with a better standard of living. For this reason she and her husband decided to generate more income for their household. Maria Margarita makes clothing, something she learned some while ago during a course that she took. She is now getting some good orders from her customers so she is earning enough money for her children to have a better quality of life.

She has a big order from one customer so needs to buy supplies in order to complete the order. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy fabric and thread, and as well to have her sewing machine serviced. She hopes that her sales will increase so she can provide her children with a good education. Another hope for the future is that her children will attend university.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread, and to have her sewing machine serviced

loans.name: Mchombo

texts.en:
Mchomba is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business,  operating from home to the market whereby his potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough customers during the rainy season. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to establish a retail shop, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Tor

texts.en:
Tor is a 22-year-old married woman with two children; both of them are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Tor is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nassir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children.

Nassir has been the owner of a store since 2007, selling and fixing electrical items. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate his store. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his store.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Nena has a bakeshop that makes and sells pastries, cookies, and a variety of breads. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elvisa has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elvisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elvisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Ahmad has been an owner of a mini-market since 2009, selling dates, herbs, breads, and soft drinks and frozen beef, chicken, and fish. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a USD 1,500 loan in order to fix his market's wall, purchase a large fridge, and add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to fix his market's wall, purchase a large fridge, and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jaime Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Jaime tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona que ha luchado por salir adelante con su familia. Durante un año aproximadamente trabajo en un aeropuerto de mecánico en los Estados Unidos luego se regreso para El Salvador y estudio un curso de mecánica automotriz en la capital del país y desde entonces trabaja en ese oficio.

Jaime viaja hasta la ciudad que esta a cuatro horas de su hogar, para comprar llantas, grasa, aceite, entre otros más para venderles a sus clientes. Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar llaves de diferentes medidas, llantas y grasa, que le hacen falta en su negocio por que tiene dos meses de haber iniciado este su negocio en un local que esta alquilando y aún le hacen falta herramientas. Así Jaime brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes y le ayudara a recibir mejores ingresos para continuar trabajando. Él desea brindarles el estudio a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
42-year old Sr. Jaime is married and has two children. He has struggled greatly to help his family get ahead. For approximately one year he worked as an airplane mechanic in the United States, but then returned to El Salvador where to took an automotive mechanic course in the capital city. Ever since that time he has been working as an automotive mechanic. 

Jaime travels to the city which is four hours away from his home to buy tires, grease, oil etc. to sell to his customers. He is seeking a loan from the Campo Foundation to buy different sizes of car keys, tires, and grease as his business lacks these items. He started the business two months ago in rented premises and he still lacks some tools. With the new purchases he will be able to provide better service to his customers and earn more money so he can continue with the business. Jaime wishes to provide his children with a good education so that they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy car keys, tires, and grease

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlina has a shop that sells beauty and cosmetic products from Natasha, Avon, and Fuller Life. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy beauty and cosmetic products from Natasha, Avon, and Fuller Life to sell.

Merlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty and cosmetic products from NATASHA, AVON & FULLERLIFE for sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 23 years old and married with two children. He sells shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for sale

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is a 31-year-old married woman with two children; both of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akuol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe  is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Fe  has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for  5 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Fe  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Fe  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling to his neighbours. Stephen faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing timber. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase timber and cutting tools for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and cutting tools for his business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 31 years old, is a single young woman. She describes herself as a patient and persistent woman. For the last two years, she has been selling fruits such as mangoes and pineapples to pedestrians. Her business is in a productive and strategic place. She describes her business challenge to be the high price of fruits sold. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more fruits such as mangoes, pineapples, etc. 

Monica's hope and dream is to venture into a supermarket business in the future. Her hope and dream is to use the proceeds she gets from the business to cater for her future family daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling, such as mangoes, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Emily has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.
