La mercadería la compra en el mercado de una ciudad del oriente del país y el resto se la llegan a dejar a su casa los proveedores.

Ella no posee crédito de ningún tipo, el crédito que solicita lo hace como una alternativa de superación personal, ya que quiere instalar una tienda más fuerte en el mercado municipal. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más variedad de mercadería, lo que le permitirá vender aún más y mejorar su calidad de vida al tener mayor poder adquisitivo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 24 years old. She is the single mother of a 5 year old son and she lives in her parents' house. 

She has been buying and selling merchandise for more than a year, such as basic grains and sweets. This idea came about due to the motivation, desire to succeed, and the support of her mother. She buys the merchandise in the market of a city which is east of the country and the rest the suppliers leave at her house. 

She does not have loans of any kind. The loan that she is asking for is as an option to personal triumph, as she wants to set up a stronger store in the town market. The loan that she is asking for is to buy a greater variety of merchandise which will permit her to sell even more and improve her quality of life to have more purchasing power.

loans.use: to buy more variety of merchandise in order to sell more in the store

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be a patient man. He operates a retail store where he provides services of repairing clothes and selling new clothes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a viable and strategic area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing. James's business goal is to run a venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to sew clothes for selling

loans.name: Gricelda Cristina

texts.es:
Gricelda tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad, vive con su mamá y dos hermanos. 

Hace cinco meses ella inicio con la instalación de una tienda de productos básicos, lo hizo debido a la necesidad que tiene de generar ingresos para sobrevivir junto con su hija. La mercadería la compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, ya que la adquiere a precios más bajos. 

 El préstamo que esta solicitando Gricelda es para comprar más cantidad y con más variedad de mercadería. Su objetivo es surtir la tienda para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo generar mayores ingresos para su familia, tener una estabilidad económica y fortalecimiento de su negocio. Ella continuara trabajando muy fuerte para tener una tienda surtida.
texts.en:
Gricelda is 19 years old. She is the single mother of a 2 year old child. She lives with her mother and her two siblings.

Five months ago she began setting up a general store. She did it because of the necessity of being able to earn income in order to survive together with her daughter. She buys the merchandise in a city in the eastern part of the country, as she is able to get lower prices.

The loan that Gricelda is asking for is to buy greater quantity and more variety of merchandise. Her objective is to supply the store in order to meet the demand of her clients and at the same time to generate better income for her family, while having economic stability and strengthening her business. She will continue working very hard in order to have a diverse store.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and more variety of merchandise

loans.name: Maritazari

texts.en: Maritazari is a 41-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a produce store that he started 5 years back. He started with capital worth 800,000 but now it is worth 5 million. In spite of his progress, he faces the challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and the poor roads where he buys his produce. His dream is to educate his children and expand his store in Kamwenge. Maritazari needs the loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling

loans.name: Darius

texts.en: Darius is a hardworking married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he started last year. He started with capital worth 400,000 but now it is worth 2 million. Despite his progress, Darius faces the challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. His dreams are educating his children and expanding his business into new markets. He needs the loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 27-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a motorcyclist for the last three years and he has been renting other people's motorcycles and paying a big percentage to the owners. His dreams are to buy his own motorcycle, educate his children and build a permanent home. Richard needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es:
Guillermo es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza todos los días para sacar a su hogar adelante.
Guillermo, con 60 años de edad se encuentra casado, y todos los días se esfuerza en su trabajo con el ánimo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y el. 
Guillermo gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Guillermo, cuenta con un gran cultivo de legumbres, las cuales son reconocidas por ser de muy buena calidad. Guillermo tiene un pedido de un cliente que le compra a muy buen precio, por lo que quiere sacar adelante su producción.
Debido a situaciones adversas como el clima, Guillermo debe regar abono a su cultivo, de modo que pueda seguir creciendo para poderlo vender, sin embargo, Guillermo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar el abono, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de abono para su cultivo y nuevas semillas para sembrar. 
Guillermo espera que su negocio le siga generando buenos ingresos, para poder así seguir sosteniendo los gastos de su hogar. 

Guillermo sueña con que su negocio crezca, y su cultivo sea más reconocido. Además, sueña con brindar oportunidad de empleo a las personas del sector para que progresen económicamente.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a hard working person that tries to get ahead every day.

Guillermo is 60 years old, married, and every day works hard with the aim of improving the quality of life for his wife and himself.

Guillermo has devoted much of his life to the activity of agriculture, and thanks to this he has generated the necessary income to maintain his home.

Guillermo has a large crop of vegetables which are known for their good quality. Guillermo has an order from a client to buy at a very good price which is why he wants to go ahead with his production.

Due to adverse conditions such as weather, Guillermo needs to scatter fertilizer on his crop so that he can continue growing in order to be able to sell it, but Guillermo does not have the necessary funds in order to buy the fertilizer which is why he is hoping for a loan to provide the possibility of being able to buy the fertilizer for his crops and new seeds to plant.

Guillermo hopes that his business continues generating good earnings in order to continue sustaining his household expenses.

Guillermo’s dream is that his business grows, and his crops become more known. Furthermore, his dream is to give the opportunity of employment to people in the area in order that they might progress economically.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop and new seeds to plant

loans.name: Estela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Estela, tiene varios años, con su pequeño negocio de venta de tortilla, su pequeña pulperia quien junto a su esposo trabajan para dar lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos, estudiantes, ha venido logrando aumentar de productos, obteniendo mejores resultado de ventas.
Con el credito anterior, compro materia prima en maiz, leña, lo que palmea los tres tiempo en el dia. Con este nuevo pretamo sera para la compra de pollo, carne de res y cerdo, productos lacteos, golosinas, entre otros productos, que son de mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Doña Estela has had her little business of selling tortillas for a number of years. Her little grocery store, where she works along with her husband to provide the necessities for their four children, who are students, has continued to succeed; by increasing her products, she has obtained better sales results.

With her previous loan, she bought basic materials for making tortillas, such as corn and firewood; she makes tortillas three times a day. This new loan will be for the purchase of chicken, beef, pork, milk products, and candies, among other products which are in great demand.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, milk products, and candies to increase her sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 55-year-old married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop that she started 7 years back.  She started with capital worth 800,000 UGX and made profits, from which she has managed to buy a new motorcycle.  In spite of her progress, Rose is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time.  Her dream is educating her children, building a permanent home and moving her business to a more permanent location. Rose needs this loan to buy rice, sugar and salt for resale

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and salt

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanis

texts.en:
Fanis is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a persistent woman. She operates a retail store where she provides services repairing clothes and selling new clothes that she makes.  

Fanis has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a less competitive area and her primary customers are local residents and walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her retail store. 

Fanis will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing. Her business goal is to run another similar retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay school fees

loans.name: José Elias

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es casado con un bebe de ocho meses de edad. Él se dedica a la crianza de ganado pecuario y a la siembra granos básicos como maíz y maicillo, en la temporada agrícola, su esposa le ayuda. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos siempre han realizado estas actividades su mamá a la crianza de ganado y su papá a la siembra de granos básicos. 

Los semovientes los compra en los tiangues de la ciudad, que se encuentran a cinco kilómetros desde su casa y cuando hay alguien que venda cerca le avisan para que él los vaya a negociar. Para llegar al tiangue aborda un microbús que se demora en promedio de diez a quince minutos.

El préstamo que solicita José es para comprar dos semovientes para la crianza. De esta forma incrementara la cantidad de ganado y llegara a seis con las dos vaquillas que comprara porque serán de ordeño para la producción de leche y cubrir la demanda existente, lo que le ayudara a recibir más ingresos para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is married and has an 8-month-old baby. His work is raising cattle and planting basic grains such as corn and maicillo (similar to millet). His wife helps him during the growing season. He learned this work from his parents, since they always carried out these activities. His mother raised livestock and his father planted basic grains.

He buys his animals in the markets in the city, which are located five kilometers from his house, and when there is someone who is selling nearby, they notify him so that he can come to negotiate. He travels to the market by microbus, which takes, on average, 10 to 15 minutes.

The loan that José is applying for is to buy two cattle to raise. In this way he will increase the number of cattle he has, and he will have six with the two small cows that he will buy. They will be milked to supply milk to meet the existing demand, which will help him to receive more income to invest in the purchase of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy two cows to raise

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

Haron operates a farm where he sells maize.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members.  His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his farm business. 

Haron will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.  His business goal is to expand his business and employ more people in the next 5 years.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cotton

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old.  He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maurice S.

texts.en: Pictured above is Maurice, a secondary school teacher in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. Forty years old, Maurice was born in Makeni. A husband, and a father of seven children, Maurice has served in the teaching profession for 33 years now. His wife is a housewife. Some of his children are in college, and others are no longer attending school. Maurice has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo above is Hawanatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Makeni, Hawanatu is age 48. She is married and has five children—two in college and three in secondary school. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials, like iron, corrugated zinc, and cement for the construction of a house. At the end of each month, Hawanatu will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, and cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo above is Mabel, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Gbonkolenken Yeleh, in northern Sierra Leone, Mabel is age 47. She is married, and the couple has four children together—one in primary school and three in secondary school.  Mabel has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc., for the construction of a house. At the end of each month, Mabel will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en:
To raise the family, Mrs. Yonn, a widowed woman, runs a micro-business at home. Besides rice husbandry, she grows vegetables for sale and raises some poultry, from which she is able to earn approximately $2.00 per day. She has been blessed with two children, all of whom presently are already married. And one among them lives together with Yonn in order to help her manage the businesses.

Yonn now would like to borrow some funds from HKL to start growing her dry-season rice in a new cycle. She will use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. Yonn is very hopeful in life and business, although she is now 50 years old.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mr. Un is 51 years old and a resident of Baray District. He has a life partner in his wife, who is 49, and has been blessed with four children: one is married and three are single. Un cultivates rice crops twice a year to generate his income and takes some time to go fishing along the Tonle Sap River. His wife sells the fish he caught to local villagers and raises some piglets at home.

Un is taking out his second loan from Kiva to purchase rice seeds for five hectares of farmland and 10 bags of fertilizer. In the future, Un hopes to improve his family-owned businesses and generate additional household income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for five hectares of farmland and 10 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Onoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Onoria tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida  y dos hijos.  La hija que esta pequeña asiste a la escuela, el hijo mayor no estudia porque no alcanzan con los gastos de los dos, por lo que el hijo mayor trabaja en la agricultura para cubrir sus gastos personales. Ella trabaja como cocinera en un negocio de venta de comida desde hace cinco años. Para llegar a su trabajo se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para abordar un autobús a las 5:30 a.m. que recorre unos cinco kilómetros. Lo primero que hace al llegar a su trabajo es poner a descongelar toda la comida que se cocinara ese día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que esta recién construida y le hace falta repellar las paredes y otros detalles para dejarla más amena. Lo primordial para Onoria es tener un techo confortable para su familia, un espacio solo para ellos, ya que siempre ha vivido con más personas. Además su vivienda será un patrimonio para sus hijos y hace que se sienta orgullosa de ser una mujer emprendedora y digna de su trabajo. Mas adelante piensa solicitar otro financiamiento para ponerle el piso a la casa, ella desea que su hija continué estudiando, y brindarle el estudio al hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Onoria is 37 years old. She lives with her life partner and two children. Her daughter, who is little, attends school. Her older son does not go to school because they can't manage the expenses for both, so her older son works in agriculture to pay for his personal expenses. She has been working for five years as a cook in a business that sells food. To get to her work, she gets up at 4:30 a.m. to take a bus at 5:30 to go about five kilometers. The first thing she does when she arrives at her work is take out all the food that will be cooked that day to thaw. 

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in improving her house, since it was recently constructed and the walls need to be plastered, and other details to make it more pleasant. The primary goal for Onoria is to have a comfortable home for her family, a space only for them, since she has always lived with more people. In addition, their house will be an inheritance for her children and it makes her proud to be an entrepreneurial woman who is worthy of her work. In the future, she is thinking of applying for another loan to install a floor in the house. She wants her daughter to continue going to school and to offer schooling to her older son.

loans.use: to improve her house, since it was recently constructed and the walls need to be plastered and other details to make it more pleasant

loans.name: Duo Danny's Group

texts.es:
DUO DANNY'S
Integrada por  la señora Lucia de 51 años de edad, doña Lucia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, desde hace 10 años, inicialmente vendía refacciones para los niños que pasaban hacia la escuela de la  su localidad, y al darse cuenta que a los alrededores no había una venta de tortilla  se motivo gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de una muchacha que laboraba con ella adicionalmente, y tambien ahora ella vende ropa típica en la ciudad capital  únicamente los días domingos,y por lo nismo esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mais por mayo y compra de mercaderia para la venta de ropa tipica, como comerciante conoció a la señorita María Eugenia, de 19 años,  quien desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carnitas y chicharrones, a un costado de la venta de tortillas de doña Lucia, Eugenia cuenta que el negocio que atiende fue gracias a la iniciativa de su mama, rentando un local y darse a conocer en su comunidad por la rico y sabrosa preparación de sus carnitas y chicharrones, ahora cuentan con dos chicharronerias en la ciudad capital.
Doña Lucia necesita de capital para poder invertir un poco mas en la venta de tortillas y  de ropa típica por la temporada de navidad, y año nuevo, como también Eugenia tiene gracias a Dios varios pedidos de carne para convivios navideños, por lo que deciden trabajar juntas como compañeras de crédito y mujeres exitosas.
texts.en:
The "Duo Danny's" group is made up of Lucia who is 51, and Maria Eugenia who is 19. 

Lucia has been making and selling tortillas from her home for ten years. At first she sold snacks to children who passed by on their way to the local school. When she realized that there was no place selling tortillas in the surrounding area, she started one, thanks to the support she got from a girl who worked with her as a helper. 

She now also sells traditional clothing in the capital city, but only on Sundays. So she is applying for this loan to buy corn at wholesale, and merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing. 

As a small business owner, she got to know Maria Eugenia, who for three years has been making and selling carnitas and chicharrones (barbecued pork and pork rinds) beside Lucia's tortilla stand. 

Eugenia has the business she runs thanks to her mother's initiative in renting a place, and in making a name for herself in her community for the rich, delicious way she makes her carnitas and chicharrones. Now they have two chicharrones stands in the capital city. 

Lucia needs working capital to be able to invest a bit more in her tortilla and traditional clothing businesses for the Christmas and New Year's season. 

Fortunately, Eugenia also had several meat orders for Christmas gatherings, so they are deciding to work together as loan partners and successful women.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas, and merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing.

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.ru: Чаббор трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Чтобы содержать свою семью он начал занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции более 10 лет. За эти многие годы он изучал, все стороны бизнеса и сейчас с легкостью справляется с этим бизнесом. Чаббор запрашивает займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Jabbor is a hardworking and honest person. He's married and is the father of four children. In order to provide for his family he started up farming about ten years ago. By this day, he's analyzed all aspects of this business and is now now easily capable to succeed within it. 
Jabbor is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. He's hoping for your kindness and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer
